original: Ahlgren, Carl Adolf, regementsve-terinär, Visby, f. 27/3/77 i Malmö av köpm. Carl A. o. Agnes Charlotta Svensson. G. 01 m. Ally Persson. Barn: Carl f. 01, Ally 03, Per 04. — Mog:ex. i Malmö 97, veterinärex. 01. Stud :res. t. skilda länder. Aman. i kemi o. farmaci 99-01, prakt, veterinär i Visby sed. 02, fältveterinärstip. 09, bat :veterinär v. A. 7 10, stabsveterinär v. VII milo 16, kapt. tj rställn. 19, reg:veterinär v. Evk 24, majors tj :-ställn. 32, besiktn .’veterinär v. exportslakt. nr 78 i Visby 16, exportbesiktn :-veterinär 20. En av stift, av samt ordf. i fören. Till den varmblod. hästavelns främj. på Gotl. 10, sekr. i Gotl. trav-sällsk. 07-38, hediled. där sed. 38, v. ordf. i Gotl. motorfören. 23-33, ordf. i sällsk. DBV 33, huv :man o. v. ordf. i styr f. DBV Sparbank, rev. i Gotl. Bank o. Ångfartygs A-B Gotl., led. av drätselkamm. 23-33, av stadsfullm. 33-34, ordf. i hälisovindn. RVO.
translated: Ahlgren, Carl Adolf, regimental veterinarian, Visby, born March 27th, 1877 in Malmö, to the merchant Carl A. and Agnes Charlotta Svensson. Married in 1901 to Ally Persson. Children: Carl born in 1901, Ally in 1903, Per in 1904. Graduated from the veterinary college in Malmö in 1897 and obtained a veterinary degree in 1901. Studied abroad as a resident student. Worked as an assistant in chemistry and pharmacy from 1899-1901. Has been a practicing veterinarian in Visby since 1902, awarded a military veterinary scholarship in 1909, nominated as battalion veterinarian for A. 7 in 1910, appointed as staff veterinarian for VII military district in 1916, promoted to captain in 1919, appointed as regimental veterinarian for Evk in 1924, promoted to major in 1932, and has served as veterinary inspector for export slaughterhouse number 78 in Visby since 1916 and as an export inspection veterinarian since 1920. Also served as chairman of the association for the promotion of warmblooded horse breeding in Gotland in 1910, secretary of the Gotland trotting society from 1907-1938, honorary chairman since 1938, vice chairman of the Gotland Motor Association from 1923-1933, chairman of the DBV society in 1933, and as chairman and vice chairman of the DBV Savings Bank, auditor of the Gotland Bank and the Gotland Steamship A-B, and member of the finance committee from 1923-1933 and the city council from 1933-1934. Appointed as a member of the RVO  (Order of Vasa) for his notable achievements.
